author: 80raghavendra
content: Yes, the thought was to have plots varying the chunk sizes and choose the empirically optimal size

author: s1na
content: <@!636680106630316033> <@!689635476826619924> yes that's correct. if you compare this against the previous chart you'll see total proof size is bigger. That's because of the extra hashes. Just by trial-and-error I came to 128 bytes (for a hexary trie), and 32 bytes after the transition to binary. But it would be interesting to see some more rigorous results
